intro: Thesium aellenianum, commonly known as the desert broom, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Thesium aellenianum is adapted to survive in nutrient-poor soils and can thrive in harsh, semi-desert conditions.
